org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.schema

Interface Behaviour<V extends NiOutCell>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractComputedBehaviour, AverageAmountBehaviour, DateTokenBehaviour, DirectedMeasureBehaviour, FilteredMeasureBehaviour, ForecastExecutionRateBehaviour, FormulaAverageBehaviour, FormulaicAmountBehaviour, GeneratedColumnBehaviour, GeneratedIntegerBehaviour, IndicatorDateTokenBehaviour, IndicatorTextualTokenBehaviour, MeasureDividingBehaviour, MtefBehaviour, NumericalColumnBehaviour, PercentageTokenBehaviour, PidTextualTokenBehaviour, TaggedMeasureBehaviour, TextualTokenBehaviour, TrivialMeasureBehaviour, VarianceMeasureBehaviour

    public interface Behaviour<V extends NiOutCell>
    a specification of the behaviour of a given NiReportColumn / NiReportMeasure

    • Method Detail

      • getTimeRange

        TimeRange getTimeRange()
        Returns:
        the maximum supported resolution. For any result which is not NONE, the column should contain cells which implement DatedCell

      • doHorizontalReduce

        V doHorizontalReduce(java.util.List<NiCell> cells)
        performs a horizontal reducing operation on cells: for multiple Cell's in one displayed locum
        Client code should probably use #horizontalReduce(List) instead, as that one has guards for null/empty input

        Returns:

      • getHierarchiesListener

        default java.util.function.Predicate<NiDimension.NiDimensionUsage> getHierarchiesListener()
        make the common case fast: if this function returns null, it is a shortcut for "measure listenes to all hierarchies"
        Returns:
        a predicate which governs the hierarchies whose percentages are listened to by an entity

      • getZeroCell

        V getZeroCell()
        computes a "zero" cell, which is different from an "empty" cell. For numerical cells, this is a cell with zero. For textual cells, this is an "" cell
        Returns:

      • isTransactionLevelUndefinedSkipping

        boolean isTransactionLevelUndefinedSkipping()
        returns true iff cells of this type, upon running over a transaction-level hierarchy for which they lack a coordinate and the splitter is defined, should be skipped normally all summable columns (e.g. funding cells which sum) should return true while texts should return false
        Returns:
